metadata.title: CVE-2022-1055 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - high
metadata.description:
A use-after-free exists in the Linux Kernel in tc_new_tfilter that couldallow a local attacker to gain privilege escalation. The exploit requiresunprivileged user namespaces. We recommend upgrading past commit04c2a47ffb13c29778e2a14e414ad4cb5a5db4b5

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1055` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-107-generic - 5.4.0-107.121~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-107-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-107.121~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-107-lowlatency - 5.4.0-107.121~18.04.1

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-107-lowlatency - 5.4.0-107.121~18.04.1
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-16.19').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-107.121~18.04.1').
